item.title: Afghans fear poll attacks
item.description: Afghanistan’s top security officials yesterday warned they were unable to guarantee the security of this week’s elections, despite efforts to buy off a ceasefire from off Taliban insurgents.

item.title: Obama concedes healthcare insurance measure
item.description: US healthcare reform could proceed without a government-run insurance scheme, the Obama administration is ever more frequently acknowledging, a decision that would win over some conservatives but disappoint many liberals

item.title: Deadline looms for Guaranty bids
item.description: At least one private equity consortium is considering a bid for Texas bank Guaranty Financial as the deadline for prospective buyers nears

item.title: European business trails US and UK
item.description: Companies from the eurozone are the only ones, among the trio of regions, where there have been more disappointments than positive surprises in the ongoing second-quarter results season

item.title: Iran set for first female cabinet members
item.description: Iran’s president, Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad, said he would nominate at least three female ministers were nominated in the , new cabinet for marking the first time in the Islamic republic history to his cabinet, clear reaching out to the women who have been particularly active in post-election protests against his government

item.title: BarCap pay offer questioned
item.description: JPMorgan asked the Financial Services Authority to review a multi-million pound compensation package being offered to lure one of its star proprietary traders to rival Barclays Capital, the investment banking arm of Barclays

item.title: First Eastern cash call to break ground in China
item.description: Hong Kong-based First Eastern Financial Investment Group plans to raise Rmb6bn ($850m) via a new wholly-owned China subsidiary in a breakthrough that will make it easier for international private equity firms to raise and deploy capital in the country

item.title: Iceland poised for foreign payback pact
item.description: Iceland’s parliament is close to approving the repayment of nearly €4bn by British and Dutch savers in a failed Icelandic bank

item.title: Saudi groups’ dispute sparks lending fears
item.description: The problems of Ahmad Hamad Algosaibi & Brothers Co and Saad Group have knocked about 500 points off the Saudi stock market index and forecasts will shave 0.5 per cent off the kingdom’s growth this year, a Saudi investment house said

item.title: Former UBS stars target real estate sector
item.description: John Costas and Mike Hutchins will focus on opportunities in the real estate market as part of their investment strategy for their new boutique start-up, PrinceRidge
